text:
Hi guys, i'm creating a webinar LP. I need only registered contacts to be able to see the embed. Can't do it by using a single property, because we have too many webinars (and they grow on time). Each contact need to be subscribed to the specific webinar he want to view.
Any advice?
Could you make a smart list that includes people who have registered for any webinar?
Is it an individual embed for each webinar?
Hi!
They would have to delete their info from the site.

*Challenge we're trying to solve* - :thinking_face: - HubSpot is working on a changelog for developers (WOOT!) that includes two separate categories: API and CMS. We'd like to give options for viewing and subscribing as there are 3 groups who want to see different content: Subscribe/view updates for only API, only CMS, and view/subscribe to both. 
> Question - Who's solved a similar challenge?

^ that's where I've been pointing people. (thanks for sharing <@U7SL518D6>!) - the academy is working on new, updated training... but it will be a bit before it's live. For now, that article + <#C960Q64G4|design-manager> is probably your best bet.
the challenge of having to choose? :wink:
Or a this,that,both subscription in HubSpot?
Why not a DEV environment to developp new features and send them after validation on a prod environment ?

^ we're exploring the idea of doing something in the future. That's a monster project.... for now (our "launch pad") we're thinking of keeping it simple to start and use the blog. The value comes from improving communicating changes / upcoming changes and potential breaks.... we can start simple and build from there #GDD :slightly_smiling_face:

There are two ways we've talked about it so far. 1). Have two separate blogs + use HubL to pull together 1 blog listing page. Then have subscription options: "CMS Only", "API Only", "Both". 

-or- 

2) Have one blog with tags. Then allow people to subscribe to a specific tag. Create custom email templates that pull only content from tags. 

3) Maybe there's a 3rd option we're not thinking about? - ideas?

The end result is pretty similar either way, however, I'm curious recommendations on how to setup the HubSpot side of things.

Hey maybe someone knows the answer to this. I’m using two color fields to control a gradient. I need to be able to control the opacity of both sides of the gradient but the output of the color field is just a hex and a percentage. Any ideas on how I could convert that hex to an RGB value?
<@U26DA9CQ0> <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-filters#convert_rgb>
Mother of god <@U4RP6AGV9>
Not sure how I missed that one
Thanks!
Either would work IMO, but I’m partial to the first approach (cleaner — at least from what I would imagine doing)
<@U26DA9CQ0> <@U4RP6AGV9> with the new design manager and Color Field i’m used to convert with the macro (that someone already shared in this channel)
Thanks <@U3TR96G84>! I’m using this: ```rgba({{ module.gradient_overlay_right_color.color|convert_rgb }}, {{ module.gradient_overlay_right_color.opacity / 100 }})```
Better than me :slightly_smiling_face:
I think yours is better if you’re using it in a bunch of places, so you can use some short variables.
in a custom module I will use yours and create the macro on a general stylesheet

I'm building a blog reader page and wanted to break up the content of the post into different sections. Does anyone have best practices on how to do that? Right now the entire post is being pulled in because I'm using the {{ content.post_body }}
HubL variable

I like blog with instant notiffications. I also think having it feed to <http://status.HubSpot.com|status.HubSpot.com> is good to make sure if someone checks there, the information is there as well. I think that helps with support as well
<!-- more --> is what you want to put into the blog post to have that break.
Now, you can also use a hubl function like
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/FBK3D6QCQ/truncate_a_blog_post.js|truncate a blog post>
This will allow you to truncate it on the word

I have a question about the social sharing module in HubSpot emails. I'm using an instant email on blog notifications. Is there a way to have the social sharing icons automatically use the current blog post?
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/FBK7REA65/image.png|social sharing email module>

Has anyone else noticed that the code rendering forms and stylesheets changes from day to day?  We're doing a deep styling of the site, and our code breaks every few days seemingly from HubSpot updating their framework code.  Is there any way to force it to stay at a certain version?
